content.description:
Traverse right on lower slabs and ledges. About halfway up the climb, you will have the option to follow two distinctly different lines. The right variation is easier than the left variation. The right version follows jugs up a few steep moves. The left version goes through scooped, thinner section.

In the late afternoon, the belayer should be prepared for some sunshine!
content.protection: About 11 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
From the

Playing With Fire

belay platform, walk right along easy ledges, past two small trees to a flat belay area with belay anchor bolt. This climb starts right off this ledge a little (20 feet) off the ground.

content.description: This is steeper than it looks....  Walk up the slabby apron to the third bolt located under the small headwall roof. Tiptoe left through a zone of easy, fractured rock to gain the ledge at the base of the major dihedral. Fire up the juggy, overhanging headwall following the weaknesses of the changing dihedrals, and hang on through the airy finish.
content.protection:
Clip about 12 protection bolts and 2 anchor bolts, the third bolt can be extended to manage rope drag.

This has 3-star climbing, but it passes a zone of fractured rock.
content.location: It is located ten feet right of the major dihedral that splits the cliff.

content.description: Get ready for some perma-grin.... This climb uses technical moves on beautiful stone and a lot of possible variations to tuck yourself under the large, notched roof. Don’t hang out here too long.... I would suggest going up.
content.protection: Clip about 11 route bolts and 2 anchor bolts. The second bolt can be backcleaned to manage rope drag.
content.location: Start from a large, perched ledge below and left of the obvious, notched roof.

content.description: There are multiple options to pass the technical climbing and reach the start of the main left-facing dihedral about 15 feet up. Set good gear at the top of the dihedral and over the small roof to make the step back onto the face.
content.protection: About 5 bolts, some gear up to #3, and 2 anchor bolts.
content.location: Towards the left side of the cliff, at an obvious built-up belay platform. Climb is in front of a large tree ~10’ from the wall.
